Cuerpo: The CORAL Project : CORAL is a deductive database system developed at the University of Wisconsin. It combines a powerful declarative logic-based query language with a relational database. Complex Databases Refereed Publications The Case for Enhanced Abstract Data Types Praveen Seshadri, Miron Livny and Raghu Ramakrishnan. The Design and Implementation of a Sequence Database System. Proceedings of the Twenty Second International Conference on Very Large Databases(VLDB),September 1996. Proceedings of the ACM SIGMOD Conference on Data Management,May 1994. Query Processing and Optimization Refereed Publications Cost-Based Optimization for Magic: Algebra and Implementation. SIGMOD 1996 (click here for longer version). Other Publications System for Optimizing Correlated SQL Queries in a Relational Database using Magic Decorrelation. Praveen Seshadri, Hamid Pirahesh and T.Y.Cliff Leung. The CORAL project Refereed Publications The CORAL Deductive System. Raghu Ramakrishnan, Divesh Srivastava, S.Sudarshan, and Praveen Seshadri. The VLDB Journal, Special Issue on Prototypes of Deductive Database Systems, 1994. Divesh Srivastava, Raghu Ramakrishnan, Praveen Seshadri and S.Sudarshan. Implementation of the CORAL Deductive Database System. Raghu Ramakrishnan, Divesh Srivastava, S.Sudarshan, and Praveen Seshadri. Proceedings of the ACM SIGMOD Conference on Data Management,May 1993. Tarun Arora, William Roth, Raghu Ramakrishnan, Praveen Seshadri, and Divesh Srivastava. Proceedings of the International Conference on Deductive and Object-Oriented Databases (DOOD), 1993. Raghu Ramakrishnan, Praveen Seshadri, Divesh Srivastava, and S.Sudarshan.
